name: Elliott
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
February 2024
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
Excellent location. The ground floor of a block of flats, and quiet, other than when people enter or exit the building. The space is small; one bedroom, partitioned by sliding doors. So, felt more like a studio. It was ok for the 2 of us, we were mainly out; could be tricky for 4.
There were a few surprises. The location is not on Gansevoort as listed but on Horatio, nearby. Communication (excellent) was via a colleague of the listed host,
and not via Airbnb.
The space was cosy and clean, however, exceptionally hot. The radiator in the bedroom was noisy and made sleeping difficult. There is no temperature control; it's central in the building. Opening a window did not feel secure.
The kitchen was well-equipped, but there were no tables or chairs. Also, in our view, some maintenance is required. eg loose shower tiles flagged previously, but not addressed.
We were offered a late checkout, in exchange for a five * review; we declined.

name: Bobin
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·

,

Stayed one night
review_text:
1. Communication is fast. I left the shampoo after leaving the room due to my negligence. The host tried to return the shampoo from the cleaner, allowed us to enter the building again, and helped us find it for free on day 3 after leaving.
2. The location of the accommodation is really good. I felt safe.
3. It was clean and the accommodation was really pretty organized.
4. I don't think I personally knew how to use the heating controller. I thought the problem was that a small radiator could cover the whole room, but I think I was mistaken. In personal experience, I didn't sleep well because the room was really cold because I didn't know how to use the heating controller. We have been confirmed that the host will take action on this matter. So the next guest doesn't have to worry too much.

Another issue is the AC unit which needs to be properly sealed to keep the cold air from coming in. Our room was freezing at night.

We actually left our Midtown hotel to come stay at this apartment and never regretted it for a second. The apartment itself is basically brand new. Super clean. Bedroom with sliding doors to a cozy sofa and kitchen area. Super cooling air conditioner.
Perfect location. Helpful hostess. Thanks so much!

review_text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at this fantastic Airbnb in Manhattan, and I can't recommend it highly enough. The apartment is incredibly spacious, offering plenty of room to relax after a busy day in the city. The price is very reasonable, especially considering the prime location.
Situated close to Times Square, Central Park, and the metro, this Airbnb is perfect for anyone looking to explore the heart of New York City. The convenience of having these iconic destinations just a short walk or subway ride away made our stay even more enjoyable.
Additionally, the place was spotless. The cleanliness of the apartment was impressive, adding to the overall comfort and experience. If you're looking for a great place to stay in Manhattan that offers both space and an unbeatable location, this is it!

review_text:
Amazing place with great original design. Very comfortable, cozy and clean.
The location is wonderful and Freeman Alley is a place that tourists visit every day to take photos of their urban art. Meter stops are very close and you can walk to many restaurants and shops nearby.
The rooms have a very smart and functional design. The beds are very comfortable. Everything very clean and the staff very attentive. The air conditioner in the room works and is very well regulated to your liking.
Included breakfasts give you the strength to kick the city. Very nice coffee and delicious cakes.
The common spaces are very pleasant and make you enjoy your stay when you return after a long day.
Highly recommend if you're traveling with or without family. I'd definitely come back.

review_text:
Untitled is a brilliant place to stay in NYC. Right in the heart of SoHo, all of lower Manhattan is super accessible, either by foot or subway.
The hotel has a really cool vibe, and makes you feel like you’re staying at home. (Be warned that the rooms are small, but have everything you need, so we didn’t mind - just a place to sleep!)
The staff were all very friendly and keen to help with any questions we had. Free coffee and pastries every morning was a nice bonus!

review_text: Book without fear! You will have a pleasant stay in a place full of art. The breakfast is a delicious differential. Arrive early to choose two delicious options between the cakes, puffs and baked goods, offered on the day. In addition, LES is an amazing area to stay and deserves to be explored. You can still find a piano performance over breakfast! Attention to the size of the room: very compact and no wardrobe. There is a cabinet with utilities on each floor: microwave, iron and ironing board, water cooler to fill the water bottle in your bedroom, towels and extra coffee capsules. On some floors there is also a scale, which helped a lot in the control of the weight of the suitcase. Ah! The room has a coffee machine and a micro figrobar. Soft bed and pillows. Nearby: Economy Candy, Congee Sum House, Nolita Pizza, El Castillo de Jagua, Don Ceviche in Essex Marcket, Krave Deli. Recommended! :-D

review_text: Wonderful hosting! 24-hour reception, help you with whatever you need. Very clean room and privacy in the sense of not having room service (you can request for an extra charge). There's a Whole Foods market nearby and a great pub on Bleecker Street (Bleecker Street Bar), also nearby. We love everything, the hotel has a lot of personality and although the rooms are small, they have absolutely everything you need! Comfortable bed, great shower, lots of hangers, space under the bed to put the suitcase, coffee shop with coffee at ease (just pick up more capsules in the closet that is at the end of your hallway), among other things. I was not missing anything at all. Plus the location is great, super close to the subway. You can quickly go anywhere in town! Loved my choice!

It was close to many subway lines so super easy to get around to all the sights! Also only a couple of blocks away from the Staten Island Ferry - the perfect opportunity to see the Statue of Liberty. The instructions for everything were super clear and useful during our stay. There was plenty of closet space to hang our clothes and put them in the dresser as well. His paintings were displayed everywhere which was really cool and the space is decorated so well. It is such a luxury to have so much space in this city and Luke is a wonderful and easy person to share it with! Definitely will be back the next time I come to NYC!!

It's a very clean and welcoming place to stay in Manhattan! It's downtown and near a few different Subway lines. It's also easy to get to Brooklyn if that's in your travel plan.
Luke was a very good host with items offered in the 'pantry' in the bedroom. He was very responsive and even sent me a message prior to my trip to confirm when I will be arriving. That was when I realised that I had not booked the place for the first day of the trip (one of those mistakes I made due to the time zones). When he heard about that, he provided alternatives to stay at, which I appreciated.
There are a few things you may wish to take note of. It has a shared bathroom but there was no issue during my stay. I appreciated having access to the washing machine and the dryer since I was there for close to 2 weeks.
Also, It's a walk-up apartment so you will need to take note of that (if you have issues climbing the stairs or have heavy luggage).
Overall, it was a fantastic stay. Thank you, Luke!

The apartment itself was unique and beautiful. The walls were adorned with beautiful artwork that created a unique and captivating atmosphere. It had everything we needed, from a spacious living area to a cozy and dark bedroom, which was ideal for my daughter’s sleep, but the place has lots of lamps and lights.
To get to the apartment you need to use the stairs, so if you’re travelling with a kid and a stroller, I recommend bringing a lightweight travel stroller for easier access.
We loved how Lucas had a perfect balance or being available and giving us space. He is a great host and we are already planning our next trip and without a doubt, we'll be staying with Lucas again!

My stay with Lucas was just amazing. Lucas is a very friendly person and has an open personality. I felt really at home in his house. Lucas provided coffee every morning, so I woke up with the smell of coffee - how awesome is that?! Most of the days I went out to see the city, so I could see the progress of the painting made by Lucas every evening. And Luke provided me with advice on where to go, so thanks to him I had my best experience in NYC - Sleep No More in McKittrick.
The house was nice and clean. It clearly is the house of an artist - paintings everywhere! That was one of the reasons for me to choose Lucas's appartment, and I was not disappointed.
The neighbourhood is nice as well - some shops, some restaurants in different styles and easy to get to with public transport. Try the "Dead Rabbit" pub just a few metres down the street. It has a nice atmosphere, and I enjoyed the IPA a lot.
All in all - I had a great stay in NYC, and for a big part of that I have to thank Lucas. Very much recommended place to stay.

Good place
Good room condition
Great host.
I want to stay again!
The location is near Wolga, which is relatively safe and has good security for you. There are various subway stations within a 5-minute walk, so transportation is also good.
You will be staying in a guest room in a quite spacious house where the host, Lucas lives. The bed is in good condition. There is little noise outside. There is inevitable the noise between floors upstairs.
There is a Smart TV, so you can see most of Otiti such as Disney Plus.
You can use the restaurant and refrigerator, and you can cook.
There are lots of paintings by the host, Lucas, and fresh inspiration. There is no smell of paint because of the ventilation.
The host is very kind. I was able to get a lot of inspiration from the host's life.
I would definitely stay again next time. Would recommend.

name: Beth
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Or stay with Lucas was perfect in every way! He was a wonderful host! Honestly, we have stayed in Airbnb's all over the world, and he is in our top 3 ever - right up there with Bas in Amsterdam, and Penny in Bridlington, England.
Lucas' location was perfect, very near the Bull on Wall Street, Battery Park, and the Statue of Liberty. The subway station was an easy 2 (or was it 3?) Blocks away. There were tons of great places to eat all around! His place was surprisingly quiet given that it is in downtown Manhattan!
The mattress was super comfy, and I absolutely have to know where he got his sheets! I need to buy some today!
Further, Lucas himself is absolutely charming! He was a wonderful host, with lots of great tips, and his stories are wonderful! Do not pass up the opportunity to read his Unicorn Cookbook. Definitely read it the first night you get there!
In all honesty, even though Lucas was there about 90% of the time when we were - (he works from home), it was never the slightest bit of an issue. We never even had to so much as schedule the timing with the shared bathroom. He showered well after we were gone for the day doing our touristy things. Lucas is extremely quiet, as are his neighbors.
Lucas had lots of little touches to make us feel extra welcomed -- an assignment of teas and coffees, and little sweets, and lots of notes about how to make Alexa work. :) He was also very generous about making sure that we knew that his kitchen was there for our use, should we want it.
One of the best things about Lucas's space was his artwork! So many beautiful paintings! Lucas is an award-winning artist, and living in his home for a week was like living in an art gallery!
My only caveat would be for those who might have mobility issues. There are 36 steps up to Lucas's apartment, and there is about an 18" step-up to get into his shower. These things are quite normal for New York City, but some prospective guests might need to be aware.
There is absolutely no question that we would stay with Lucas if we were to come back to Manhattan in the future! Thank you for a wonderful time, Lucas!

Home in NY!
I have been going to NY since I was a young girl. My grandmother used to live there off of 42nd. Yes 42nd the heart of the city. Not only was it the heart of the city it was part of our heart visting her. She passed 3 years ago so now. Took my daughter for a girls trip for her 18th birthday recently. Wanted to give her the experience I grew up with which was staying in an NY appartment. This I thought was going to be hard until we found LUCAS! LUCAS made us feel st home the minute we entered OUR home. I say our home because that is how he made my daughter and I feel in his space. The appointment is SUPER chic and full of great pieces of Lucas's art and pieces I could relate to. It was located across from Battery park which is an amazing park to stroll through. Very easy and SAFE to get to from MTA. We took the subway everywhere! This home will feel like your home for your time in NYC. Lucas's warm hospitality and home will make your NYC trip unforgettable! Miss Lucas and NY already.

Lovely space with Lucas' art making it unique indeed and with much more space in the main room than is usual in a New York apartment. Very well connected to everywhere by subway - the express 4 subway under ten minutes' walk can get you to Grand Central in half an hour- and of course by ferry. Also easy access to Battery park for a view of the statue of Liberty and a way to avoid the claustrophobia of the high rises in mid town.
Shower was excellent and well apportioned kitchen with real space. Lucas was away for some of our stay and entrusted us with his apartment but when he returned he was very lovely host and very respectful of us as guests.
Real chance to experience Manhattan as if you live there!

review_text:
First time ever staying in an Airbnb with the host living in as well and I was a little nervous how it would go as everybody likes a bit of privacy on holiday. My worries we're totally unfounded as Luke is one of the friendliest and most welcoming people it's been my pleasure to meet whilst travelling. Communicative, open and discreet. There if you need something and giving you space if you don't.
The apartment is beautifully decorated with Luke's"s stunning and colourful art and we were the envy of many colleagues after they had seen the gray, midtown hotel rooms they were staying in that seem the norm. The location is deliciously placed near the cooling tranquility of Battery park and the water and is a great spot to chill in after what can be a hot and gritty day in Summery Midtown.
Stone Street just around the corner is full of great bars and restaurants and the subway up north is very conveniently located.
Go for the apartment, stay for Luke. You won't be disappointed.

I love this place! Felt right at home here. Marjorie was friendly & helpful & had great recommendations for the area, where to eat ect. The room is very cozy, quiet, homily & I slept well. The private bathroom is clean & right adjacent to the room. The area (Red Hook) is quiet, clean & locals are friendly. An out-of-the-way corner of Brooklyn (with DT skyline views) which I completely enjoyed. There's a Ferry to Wall St Pier 11 & Dumbo or to GovernosIsland.
It's not far to Brooklyn Bridge Park (Pier 6) and Downtown Brooklyn or F & G Subways at Smith - 9 Sts (to other parts of BK or Manhattan) with bus B61. Coffee Shops and Restaurants are excellent!
Will definitely come back :)

review_text: Unfortunately, the listing was not quite as I had hoped. Marjorie was quick and helpful in contact remotely, but closest to me once I was there. It said that you would have access to the kitchen, but that was not quite true. I, after a lot of persuasion, got to use the gas stove, at first she wanted me to use the microwave for everything. I only cooked breakfast and only used one pot, even though the kitchen was fully equipped, after this. I would not be in the kitchen at the same time, but was referred to waiting and preferably I would stick to my room, I understood gradually. Didn't get to sit and eat at the dining table in the living room. Just didn't feel particularly welcome. Other: bed was narrow but ok, bathroom clean and warm. Great shower. Room was cold, no extra heat source. Got to keep my groceries in the fridge. I was hoping to get some good advice for my first visit to NYC, but it felt like I was most disturbing. Sad, because I think we had a lot of interests in common!

Her unit was right in the heart of an adorable, eclectic neighborhood that has restaurants and shops within a short walk. One of the highlights was the NYC ferry, which was only 3 short blocks that took you to Pier 11/Wall St. It was literally a 10 mins ride to Manhattan for $4.00. I took it several times, and it was incredibly efficient with beautiful scenery. Highly recommend staying with Marjorie. I hope I get a chance to visit again soon.

You can get to Manhattan by ferry, beautiful! Or drive with bus 61 near the apartment, but its passage is a little random sometimes. Or walk 20 minutes to the subway.

name: Jennifer
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
By far, the best Airbnb I’ve stayed at in NYC.
The basic…safety, cleanliness, comfort…were all excellent, but Marjorie’s space is a sanctuary and a must see hidden treasure NYC spot. (Even if you aren’t staying there, or are looking for a staycation or some inspiration, you’d want to visit her space).
Her art collection is amazing. Her space is a borderline women’s rights museum… that is very inspiring and empowering! (This is including the wall of Marjorie’s achievements). ❤️
The space is very peaceful, full of love, flair and intelligence.
I’m lucky that I was able to take a tour of the space. And grateful for the stay. The community was awesome, full of love, friendliness and respect. Citi Bike dock literally down the street and easy walk to the ferry dock (so peaceful beats the subway times a million).
The cherry on top, was the short walk/run recommendation Marjorie gave me to Valentino Park…..no words, all heart… probably the most serene spot I’ve encountered in NYC. 🫶

review_text: Our first flight was canceled, and our next flight didn't get in til a ridiculous time in the next morning. Milton arranged for a way for us to easily get in at 4 am with very specific instructions and signs that made everything clear. The apartment was extremely clean and just as described. It worked perfectly for our group of 3. The location works well if you are a walking group- we walked back from the subway every evening between 10-midnight. Although there were colorful characters around as expected, it felt safe for someone who wasn't walking alone. Milton also offered to let us keep our luggage at the apartment as our flight didn't leave until 6 pm. We would definitely stay here again.

review_text: The very first host we've encountered who waited for us outside their home, greeted us, walked us in, showed us their home, & most of all, chatted with us the moment we arrived! I was shocked because most hosts do not do this, so it was meant a lot & it definitely made both my husband & I feel at home. Milton was super kind & friendly. His home looked exactly the photos & was very clean. It's a very big space (especially for 2 people) compared to the hotels I've stayed at in NYC. Very comfy bed & the duvet was amazing! The brownstone home is just a 5 min walk from the subway which was a plus! There's also a deli & grocery store down the block if you want to grab some chopped cheese late at night. We'd love to stay here every time we visit NYC! It was such a pleasant stay & it's all because of that very first greet the moment we got out of our Uber. It makes such a big difference in the world to be greeted by your host! See you soon Milton!

Milton was a great host and was very accommodating. He met us early to take our bags before the room was ready, and allowed us to drop keys off as we had to leave a day early. Milton was great chatting with and was always very responsive when we chatted.
We would happily stay with Milton again.

review_text: The host, Milton, made us feel at home and was even kind enough to accommodate our need to drop off luggage a bit early. We had the 2nd floor street-facing room which was very clean, spacious, and well arranged. Towels were clean, plenty of hangers, comfortable L-sofa, full sized fridge/freeze and microwave, and other kitchen essentials we would need. The drip coffee machine was essential for our morning routine so it was well appreciated. We always looked forward to returning to the comfortable and relaxing room after a long day of exploring NYC to wind down. If I were to return to the area I would definitely put Milton's place at the top of my list again.

Cozy apartment as seen in the listing. Very clean and the kitchen has everything you need to prepare breakfasts.
Milton is 10: he greeted us kindly even though we were a little late, he explained everything to us, gave us recommendations and allowed us to delay the departure until our flight time.
The location of the apartment is perfect because it has very close to the 125st station that allows you to get to the center in 15 minutes (lines A and D especially).
Despite being in Harlem, it's a safe neighborhood (we moved around the night and first thing in the morning and we never had a problem). It is true that there are certain groups that are formed at night but they never told us anything, although perhaps the worst thing is the noise they generate, that if you have light sleep you do not rest well.
It is a recommended accommodation to spend a few days in New York at a price and with a reasonable quality.

The kitchen has everything that is needed to make breakfast or to cook basic meals. Harlem in general is a little further away from the typical sights, but we really enjoyed walking through the Central Park and there is a subway station relatively close by to go to downtown. The neighborhood itself also offers plenty of food and fun places to visit.
We had a wonderful stay and would recommend Milton’s place 100%. We would love to come back!

The studio has lots of natural light and a bright airy feel with lovely high ceilings and some characterful furniture. We loved the location as it was very conveniently near Columbia, but also near the express subway lines for exploring the rest of manhattan. We felt safe and secure in the area and it was near a couple of different grocery stores and some cultural landmarks like the Apollo. Milton was welcoming, friendly and very responsive to any questions and was kindly flexible with our checkout time. I would definitely recommend staying here.

But we circled for a long time looking for parking both evenings, and both times had to park blocks away and around a few corners, which we weren't mentally prepared for. Had to drag our stuff in the rain for those blocks to the place. I would still have taken the place if I knew but would likely have arranged to arrive earlier, when it was still light out and more parking might be found. Otherwise, a good deal and a good place.

review_text:
My stay at Julie’s was great!
The house had a nice, welcoming vibe. The room got me full privacy and a very nice sunrise. It’s a quiet, peaceful room with a warm atmosphere. The kitchen is spacious and everything you need is easy to access. The house was peaceful and stress free. Julie was a wonderful host, always ready to help if needed.
The train is very close (3 min for real) the station has an elevator. The closest supermarket is 1-2 min away.
I had a very enjoyable, relaxing week and I fully recommend it.

Perfect place to stay if you’re a solo traveler and need somewhere to stay that feels safe and friendly if you are unfamiliar with or nervous about staying alone in Brooklyn. Will definitely book again if I’m ever in the area!

I was pleasantly surprised to see how comfortable it was, how private the bathroom was, and how friendly the host and her family were. I ended up relaxing in the bedroom much more than I expected to! Julie and her family were very helpful, provided us with all the advertised and necessary utilities, and made it easy for us to keep our privacy and go in and out as we pleased. Not the calmest place in the world, but compared to other places I stayed at in the area, this was relatively very light on street noises as it was on a more private road. Also, importantly, it is just a block away from the subway station, so going to Manhattan using the 2 and the 5 was a breeze. I loved my experience and would definitely repeat it again!

review_text: Had a great stay with my wife for a weekend in NYC. We found parking right down the street and walked about 5 minutes. Check in was incredibly easy and very friendly staff. We got up to the room relaxed and used the shower. Very clean room and bathroom with a nice bed. We had a late night out and got back around 5AM. It was nice that check out was at 12PM and we were able to rest and cleaned up before heading out. Check out was again incredibly easy and friendly staff. We didn't explore the neighborhood too much because we have lived in NY/ NYC our whole life. Really just needed a place to stay for the night for our date night and it was perfect. When we left there was a big food street fair going on and tons of stores and things to do. If we find an event nearby again I would for sure stay here. Thanks for a good time!

review_text:
Chelsea's place is in fact a room at the HANTON Inn Manhattan Chelsea hotel.
The rooms are all well made, very large, clean and with a large bathroom.
Breakfast is included in the price and it's not bad. The only flaw in the breakfast area is that there are some tables nearby, a strong smell of vinegar because they use a very unpleasant cleaning product. The rooms are missing hangers or a jacket hangers and need a new air conditioner because it is very old and noisy.
The rest of the room is perfect, large spaces, very comfortable bed and large bathroom. Bath products are also good. I especially appreciated the size of the room, really spacious by New York standards.
host Chelsea doesn't exist, but you'll find the hotel staff at the front desk.

Next time I will ask host about reservation info prior to my trip.

review_text: "There will be mandatory taxes and fees" is not a good enough sentence, especially when it's buried deep inside the listing. There will be a mandatory 15% tax/fee to be paid is more like, as the first sentence of your listing. Otherwise, ok enough. Bathroom lacked space, furniture, fittings and appliances were aged but clean, the complimentary breakfast was really inn-like (would've been cute in an actual inn, but it just felt tawdry in this hotel-like place), and I spent 30 minutes in the check-in line, and 20 minutes in the checkout line. Overall, happy with the stay, but unhappy with the surprise 15% fees. I was under the impression that the credit card charge they made at check-in was simply a refundable security deposit.

Know this, YOU WILL BE CHARGED TAXES AND FEES ON TOP OF WHAT YOU PAY TO AIR B&B. We got charged an additional $233 from this hotel. Yes, a hotel, not a home. We don’t have as much a problem with it being a hotel. We do have a problem with hidden fees.
I’ve never had an air b&b stay cost extra fees so I did NOT expect this.
I’m surprised air b&b would allow this.
Other than that, it was a normal hotel stay. Not overly fancy. Good location. Clean.
I do prefer homes over hotels, that’s why I use air b&b. Now I know I have to be very careful in the future.

name: Lindsay
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
3 weeks ago
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
There was so much that I loved about staying at The Arthouse! The location, the Patis Bakery, the Arthouse Bar, the communication from the hotel itself, and the proximity to great restaurants - just to name a few.
However, I experienced some unfortunate issues that impacted my stay and rating, most of which applied to the room itself. The entire room was covered with hair when I arrived. It was clear that some areas were wiped clean, but the floors, desk, coffee table, and bathroom were wildly dirty. There were still toothpaste stains on the shelves in the bathroom and some stains on the lampshades/curtains as well. I ended up going to the CVS next door to get some cleaning supplies so that I could take care of things myself to feel more comfortable. As a solo female traveler, I chose not to draw attention by alerting the hotel.
I've provided this feedback to the Airbnb host, as it seems it could be an Airbnb issue and not a hotel issue. I hope it gets better in the future!

rating_info:

,

February 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: It just doesn’t get any better than this beautiful space. We felt welcome and the view made you want to jump up and down on the bed in glee (which we didn’t do). I would come back in a heartbeat. ❤️ The property is in a very safe building acrosss from Central Park. The location allowed us an easy walk to Broadway, Carnegie Hall, MoMA, and the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Kitchen amply stocked with everything needed to cook (we didn’t). And the apartment was very quiet compared to the noise associated with NYC after dark (the city truly never sleeps). Check-in was super easy and helpful. Local recommendations for dinner were included. We fell in love with the Carnegie Diner. This is your pie superstore, btw. Temperature controls in the apartment were cozy, big tv with streaming, and a shower with water pressure worth the soaking. I wouldn’t change a single thing. Be careful that you look for window washers when getting dressed 😜.

I’ve been using airbnb for many years now but I’ve never had a place where offers you two water bottles for the stay. Just with this fact, you could tell how thoughtfully managed this place is.
On top of that, there is a TV with premium channels, a super comfy bed, a perfect shower booth, well equipped kitchen, a safe entrance, a beautiful backyard etc. I mean seriously Martin’s place has it all.
If you want to make your NY trip extraordinary, I highly recommend this place. Because you can’t go wrong with this air bnb!

review_text:
What an exceptional experience for our first AirBnB experience!!! Marty is excellent at communication, friendliness, and meeting his guests' needs! He has renovated a beautiful garden apartment in shades of gray with a lovely tile floor, new bathroom with fabulous steam shower, comfy bed, and beautiful view (including use) of his backyard garden & dining area. What a peaceful oasis in NYC and yet easily accessible to Central Park!
The neighborhood is lovely -- with his townhouse on a street lined with trees, interesting and beautiful townhomes of either brick or stone. And yet if you love Dunkin Donuts, there is one just around the corner. There are many very good restaurants close by -- unfortunately due to scheduling we didn't have a chance to sample them on this trip.
Also when we expressed a special need, Marty very generously extended himself by taking his personal time and walking many blocks to meet our request. This is really far and away what most hosts would do! Thank you, Marty, for a great and memorable stay!

We easily walked to Central Park and down to the Natural History Museum to see “dinosaur bones” as my kid exclaimed, with playground stops along the way. Columbus and Amsterdam have great shops and restaurants, too. I only wish we could have stayed longer!

name: Nathan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2022
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
I chose the studio because of the location. Having lived in NYC for two years, I knew I wanted to stay on the Upper West Side. It's just a wonderful part of Manhattan. Even without taking anything else into account, the location is perfect. It's a couple of blocks from various Subway lines, including express lines; bus stops, restaurants, grocery stores, and not to mention Central Park! So, for example, if you want to go to Times Square, you can walk two and a half blocks from the studio and take the express Subway line and be in Times Square in literally two stops. This is a great neighborhood to experience life "as a New Yorker," if that makes sense. You have access to everything, but are not staying in a tourist trap. Every morning I walked a couple of blocks to an Italian coffee shop to have a chocolate croissant and a cappuccino, and passed by locals walking their dogs and commuters going to work. Just a great neighborhood vibe.
In terms of the studio itself, you can't ask for a better Air BnB. The host (Marty) is professional and well organized, and he takes his role as host very seriously. He really cares about your comfort and is easy to reach. That said, he also expects you to follow very reasonable rules he has set out. When you go into the studio and you understand the neighborhood dynamic, it becomes evident why those rules are in place. I would say that if you're looking for a place to party and make noise at all hours, this studio (or this neighborhood) may not be a good fit.
By NYC standards, you have plenty of space and you have a private patio, which is unheard of! The studio also has a remodeled sink and shower with fancy jets. The bedding is very comfortable, and there are enough places to sit, as well as surfaces to set things down. Again, this is by NYC standards. (New York is a place where physical space is always in short supply.)
Highly recommended!

Stayed over a week
review_text: From the beginning, I felt welcomed and at home at Allison’s place. We were both quite busy — I was staying in New York for work — but Allison was always very friendly, kind, helpful and warm-hearted. She was always very open and listened to me when I need to get some (personal) things off my chest. Her dog was super cute and quiet. I didn’t mind that Allison was reorganizing her place when I was there — and she was super apologetic about it, but the shared spaces were always very usable and my room was great. She always made it clear that my room is my space and that she would never enter without my knowing or permission. I asked for clothes hangers and she gave me that plus a whole rack for my clothes. The bed was spacious and really comfortable, and the little heater was helpful when it got cold. The area felt safe, even at night — which is important as a young woman. I definitely recommend staying here if you’re in NYC! Amazing quality for the price!! Great experience overall :)

Truly 5 stars! Sara and her brother Matt are excellent hosts. We lived in Manhattan some years ago, and we wanted a nice place with a kitchen, laundry and space for the four of us to relax and be together when not going around the City.
From the time I booked, Sara was very responsive and very nice, and when we stayed, her brother Matt was equally so.
They did all the extra little things, and they clearly care about their guests. We felt that, and they even sent a gift my son saw and complimented (just to be nice).
The gym was fantastic on the 30th floor, but it was clear the building is trying to make it more challenging for short term rentals, and so if you are a gym rat, reach out and make sure that still is okay.
They said “our home is your home” and they meant it.
It is a lovely unit, with great views, comfortable firm beds and fantastic hosts. Not cheap, but in our eyes, absolutely worth it!

we hired the cleaning service that was spectacular

What an amazing space with literally million dollar views. No need to go to the Empire State Building or other high scraping attractions when you stay here. Aside from aesthetics, which were top notch, the host/s were absolutely amazing. From spending hours helping us before we got there coordinating lost grocery deliveries to checking in while we were there to make sure everything was okay they were so supportive and kind and helpful. The location puts you so close to theaters, food, subways, and most everything you would want to see is within a 20 minute walk if you opt out of public transportation.
We were 3 adults, a teenager and a 7 y/o and we fit perfectly into the space. It was comfortable, spacious, full of all of the things you need for it to feel like home and so quiet. I absolutely recommend the space, and Sara and Matt pushed it over the top. For many of our party’s first time in New York, it was an unparalleled experience and the home had so much to do with it.

The location was fantastic walkable to many of the tourist attractions and Broadway theaters. The apartment was very spacious and comfortable for a family of 4. The rooms were cozy, and the living room/kitchen area had enough space for us to hang out. Sara and Matt were very responsive and attentive to our needs during our stay, which made communication between us very hassle-free. Checkin and check out were both simple and easy.
More so, the apartment had a great views of the city, including the Empire State Building, and it was a beautiful sight to see, especially at night. In conclusion, I would definitely recommend this apartment to anyone visiting New York. It contributed to making our trip an enjoyable and memorable one.

Stayed with kids
review_text: From start to finish, the hosts (Sara and Matt) were incredibly proactive and helpful. There were some issues that were out of the control of the hosts, but they were quick to respond and came up with fair solutions. The condo itself has the most amazing views and the amenities were used often (pool, jacuzzi, terraces). Plenty of space with the 2 bedrooms and a large living area. We've been to NYC over 30 times in the past 30 years and have never quite stayed so close to Times Square. Being at such a high floor level cut down tremendously on the noise so that was not a factor at night. The location was WEST midtown so that was much better than being in the heart of Times Square. We did enjoy the local food places (as usual) and found ourselves going to more Broadway shows just because it was so close. If you have any hesitation about staying near Midtown, I think families will enjoy this condo. We were a bit nervous at first, but this was a great decision.

Tips nearby:
Supermarket: Big Apple Meat Market
Very nice selection of meats, vegetable and herbs
Sea Breeze Fish Market
Perfect selection of fish, mussels, crustaceans. Tuna in sushi.
Wine
West 42nd Wine and Spirits: Great selection of wines.
Fresh Direct
Online Supermarkt. Versatile selection. Reliably delivers in a 2-hour time slot. You don't have to be home. Packages are received at the bottom of the building. They even have a huge fridge for food deliveries so nothing spoils.

This is our second time saying at Sara’s apartment and won’t be our last. The views are priceless and breathtaking. Hudson River on one side - Hell’s Kitchen to the front (you can even see Central Park) and Empire State Building to the other side.
The apartment has a great layout with views from every window and so spacious. It’s nice having a washer dryer to clean all your clothes upon leaving.
The area is safe with a market across the street and good Italian restaurants in just walking distance in Hells Kitchen. Easily can walk to time square or catch a short Uber outside. We even walked back from Central Park and just took 20 minutes.
Door dash and Uber Eats and Amazon deliver right to Saras apartment door BTW.
The buildings doormen are pleasant. Sara is helpful!
I would highly recommend staying here to fully experience your NYC trip in style!

name: Patric
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2022
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: What a fabulous apartment! The outstanding experience begins with easy, quick and friendly communication with the hosts Sara and Matt. The apartment offered everything we needed as a family of 4 to explore the city: Enough space for adults and teenagers, very well-equipped kitchen for breakfasts and drinks (we did not cook, but everything would be there to do so), comfortable beds to recover from long walks, very limited noise considering a location in the heart the apple. A lot of attractions are within walking distance of few minutes, including many good restaurants, food markets and shops, as well as most Broadway theaters and access to the subway station. To use up your final energy there is a large, clean, supervised gym, a nice swimming pool and jacuzzi with view of the Empire State building. But without a doubt, the most spectacular aspect of the apartment are the breathtaking views from all rooms, all the way from the Hudson River, small parts of the Central Park, midtown high rises such as the Empire State building down to One World Trad tower and even the sea! We could not stop enjoying the ever-changing shades of light, highlighting different details of the town as the day (and night) went by. So in short, the apartment is worth every penny, and we could not think of a more easy and at the same time spectacular way of experiencing NYC. A big thank you to Sara and Matt for being such wonderful hosts.

name: Amy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2022
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: We had a wonderful time at Sara and Matt’s apartment! The apartment itself is very luxurious. The location is excellent, the views are spectacular, it was extremely clean and organized, all the communication with the hosts was great, the doormen and staff were extremely nice and helpful, everything about checking in/out was easy. The apartment is very high up, so it’s very quiet and peaceful. You don’t hear much at all from the street. The area around the building is safe to walk through - we walked to and from the theaters very easily. It’s a short walk to get to the subway or to Times Square or to a nice supermarket. We had intended to fly but ended up driving, so Matt gave us some suggestions for where to park our car and that was great - it was only a block away and the cost was reasonable. The bathrooms are very nice and there’s an incredible amount of storage in the larger bathroom. Lots of drawers with organizers in them, so you can unpack and put away all your toiletries and cosmetics. And the showers were fantastic! The one in the larger bathroom has a deep soaking tub, too and they are almost completely enclosed, so the steam stays in them and doesn’t fog up the mirrors at all. We were exhausted at the end of every day, so a long, hot shower was much appreciated! Don’t hesitate to stay at this apartment! It’s fabulous and we would not hesitate to stay there again! Thank you, Sara and Matt!

review_text: What we can tell is that the apartment dazzled us from entering it, including from the entrance to the building, including from the entrance to the building. The views it has are fascinating, as being at an angle of the building has stunning views to the east and north. All rooms have tremendous views. Also, the apartment is super comfortable for a family with three children like mine. The equipment exceeds all expectations, making you feel truly at home since you will not miss anything at home, we even feel better than at home!!! The location is spectacular! Being extremely close to everything!, but at the same time in a place that is not as noisy as in time square (I think better located could not be) Finally, but I think it is the most important thing, we have to highlight the friendliness, attention and warmth of Sara and her brother Matt, who were always by our side so that our stay is 10 points and undoubtedly was 11 points. Even Matt, which I already consider a friend, was always on the lookout and helping us with problems in the return flight when the stay was over. In short, we can say that everything was super spectacular and highly recommended. We will definitely rent this apartment again and see Matt and Sara that we are already missing them.

This apartment surpassed all of our needs and expectations. The views are truly phenomenal (hard to decide if they're better at night or during the day), the furnishings are extremely comfortable (namely great beds!), and because of the high floor, we were able to enjoy NYC in this very peaceful and exceptionally quiet apartment. Our hosts thought and responded to our every needs—I inquired ahead of time about the coffeemaker, and they were thoughtful enough to ensure we had ample coffee pods for our stay! The building is clean and safe and has great amenities. Highly recommend!

Easy to get to from Newark, NJ Airport and everything we needed was close by…In New York there’s a lot of walking and Lucineia’s place is in the perfect spot!!
We saw a show at Radio City Music Hall and it was a very comfortable walk there and back with so much to see and do on the way.
Lucineia is so easy to text with and her response was always quick.
I’ve stayed at many Airbnb’s around the U.S. and Europe and for sure on my next visit to New York City I will most definitely look up Lucineia!
Thanks so much for the Great Place and Service!!

June 2023
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
Two of us spent 18 nights in the apartment so got a good feel for this nice one bedroom apt, as well as the area. The apartment is bright, but quiet, as the windows give on to a space between buildings and backyards instead of the street. The bathroom and shower are very good with lots of storage space for toiletries. The kitchen is decent, not fully equipped, but good for breakfast and very light meals. Air conditioning is welcome and comes in handy, but depending on the weather you can also get a good breeze through the window. The apartment is tastefully decorated with quality items including a wood floor comfortable bed, and big mirrors. The elevator is fast and efficient, and the entry is safe, with an external locking gate. The area (north Chelsea) is very convenient for subway and train connections, and has a good amount of convenience stores and supermarkets nearby. We walked almost everywhere in Manhattan from there.
Check in and was fast and simple.

Stayed with kids
review_text: Lucineia's place was located in a convenient location, easy access to the subway, and close to many restaurants and shops. The Airbnb was spotless and was accurate to the listing description. The apartment inside appears new and modern. We also appreciated that the host provided a pack 'n play crib upon request, which was important as we were traveling with our toddler. We enjoyed our stay overall and would come back! A few suggestions would have made the process even better, such as communicating directly in the Airbnb app (vs. text), making sure the right address was listed, and specifying what coffee maker was available since coffee/coffee pods were not provided. Otherwise, we were happy with our stay and would recommend this Airbnb to others visiting NYC!

review_text:
I book Airbnbs more than half of the time I travel and sometimes it’s a hit or miss. This wasn’t the case with this space. I will 100% be re booking this space when I am visiting NYC. Lucineia was an amazing host who sent check in instructions well ahead of time, she was accommodating to our travel plans, and was over all an amazing communicator. The space really felt like home and matched the description/photos.
The airbnb is super close to a lot of things. There’s a Whole Foods, Starbucks, Hudson yards, Trader Joe’s, Walgreens, all within a 5-10 minute walk. It is also really quiet which was important for us as the city can be a bit loud at times. The bed and linens were very comfortable! The kitchen has what you need if you prefer to cook which we did a few of the nights. The unit has a nice view but still offers privacy. Lastly, I think this space is in a great area for those who are newer to NYC or more experienced :)

name: Nieves
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
3 weeks ago
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
For me it was a perfect place for a 7-day stay in New York. It is certainly not cheap, but there is no cheap accommodation in New York.
I thought it was perfect for money.
It's true that the rooms are the right size, but in my case, I didn't need more. A good bathroom and a good room.
In terms of location, it is what would most highlight of the accommodation, you can move perfectly walking anywhere and if you do not want to walk, you have the entrance to the Canal St metro at the gate.
There are a lot of noise negative food items, but it didn't seem so bad to me. It is true that there is noise, but it is bearable if you are not very manic and you can sleep perfectly.
The only negative point I would put is that they do not do the cleaning while your stay lasts, but I already knew it in advance, since they clearly indicate it, and that the windows seemed to have never been cleaned, but well... I would not stop going for that reason.

Besides that everything is great! I’m a NYer and needed a little staycation to help make work commute easier & something cheap. Affordable for NYC prices and right in the middle of everything. Will definitely be back again!

The location is perfect because it’s right next to the subway entrance which makes it really easy to get around and find your way back with no trouble. If you fly to JFK and get a subway R,Q,N to downtown get off on Canal St. and it will drop you off right at the location. There was great Delis around to have breakfast on the go or to eat there as well. I feel satisfied with the money value of this place. I recommend it and would come back.

This host was absolutely great. I never feel comfortable in an Air BNB unless it is very clean. This place made me feel right at home. I wasn’t once concerned about the cleanness. The sheets were fresh, and the bathroom was great. There were so many amenities that I wasn’t expecting. Such as the complete kitchen (oven, toaster, fridge, microwave, etc.)
The location is amazing, as it is less than a block from the subway line. There are grocery stores walkable distance too.
The host was very responsive and quick to action on every concern we had, even though they were on vacation as well. Super super friendly. Would definitely stay here again whenever in New York!

review_text:
I wasn't sure if staying so far uptown was going to work out for me, but I was wrong, it really was the BEST way to do my visit to NYC. The AirBnB is a basement apartment, but it's wonderful because it's as peaceful and quiet as you can get in NYC. I saw that someone felt the apartment was quite dark, but as someone who doesn't sleep well without blackout curtains, it was perfect for me.
The place is exactly as described and it's like you're staying in the downstairs of a relative's house where you are free to come and go as you wish. Street parking is free in this area for those who drive in and the subway station is just a half a block away.
There's also a ton of great sights in Upper Manhattan within walking distance such as Hamilton's Grange and the historic brownstone lined streets. There's a great coffee shop just up the way and just so much history all around. Not to mention, you're just 20 minutes away from anything you want to do Downtown.

The place was spotlessly cleaned and unbelievably well equipped, right down to the pots and pans, silverware, dishes, glasses, feather comforters, and even laundry detergent and dryer sheets. Nighttime was dead silent, the bed was firm like I like it, and the heat and hot water were more than generous. Their communication went above and beyond, which really made me feel welcome. The next time I’m in NYC I’ll check their availability before any other.

name: Sam
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

·

,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
Exactly as described, immaculately clean. Premium finishes; didn't feel like Wayfair/IKEA furniture. Plenty of linens. Didn't feel like a tiny New York studio. Good internet.
Everything you could possibly need for an extended stay, seriously. Didn't have to buy anything "home" related (cleaning supplies, sponges, paper towels, Tide pods, etc.)
Fast elevator. Laundry room was never busy, affordable. I didn't see anyone over 35 in the building ever, but not loud or busy. No families. Cute guys.
I am very picky and this place was 5-stars, 100% met my needs. Good value.
Location (irrelevant to the host and apartment):
- 2 trains nearby if that'll be your method of getting around.
- Not much to do or eat down there, but easy to hop to other neighborhoods. No stores, markets, simple restaurants, etc. Unless you're going to Cava or Cipriani every night, you'll need to travel to eat.
- I think Ubers cost less coming from that area, but there are fewer. Had to wait every now and again.

A very well located apartment, close to many subways which makes it very easy to walk around Manhattan and have access to all the places to visit quickly. Emir is very responsive and very friendly, he always responded quickly to our requests and even allowed us to leave our luggage until the evening since we had a late flight. The apartment is large and very convenient, it has everything you need for a pleasant stay.
The only downside is the bar that is below that made a significant noise on Friday nights and a terrible noise on Saturday nights until very late, it was impossible to sleep before 2:30 am. So accommodation to avoid on weekends if it's like this every weekend or we were not lucky on the 2 Fridays and the Saturday we were there. The bar is closed on Sundays and Mondays.
At Emir's, a perfect place to visit New York on weekdays.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: A 5-day stay. This quiet street of brownstones in Harlem provides a great base location for an NYC trip, with full privacy at a reasonable rate (comparatively). Neighborhood is not wealthy, but as long as you don't dress in a show-off way, and can mind your business while walking, you'll be fine. Lots of local non-brand businesses, with interesting restaurants. Try King Barka chicken for cheap. Go find Sylvia's for fancy and historic. Parking was the easiest in the city. Apartment was very nice, with a double bed, and full kitchen. Bathroom clean as well. Milton was flexible to allow an earlier check-in as I was moving from one AirBnB to another. Excellent communication. He greeted me at the door and gave me the keys after a brief and friendly chat. I'll hope to stay there again if I can book the space for my next trip. If this is available for your dates, you should grab it.

White Space hosted by Milton was perfect for location (safe, close to shops, subway) and the unit had all the features and services as advertised. 
When communicating with Milton prior to our arrival, he gave us excellent instructions on getting to his place from the airport which was really helpful the following days finding our way to and from the subway.
Milton also gave great advice on the local area, and helped planning our daily trips around NY. 
We really felt at home and would highly recommend it to anyone who visits NY.
The local subway (125th Street) has  express services and you can be in midtown in 10 minutes downtown in 15 minutes

We flew into NYC early in the morning from a long overseas flight & Milton agreed to let us move into the rental unit way before the check-in time. He gave us directions to the property & was waiting for us when we arrived. He helped us with our luggage & as soon as we got inside the unit talking with Milton was like conversing with an old friend. He made us feel at home. The unit itself was as described & more than met our expectations. The unit is extremely close to a variety of subway lines & other public transportation, & for walkers/hikers like we are, it’s also close to Central Park. We had a fabulous & restful time at Milton’s place & we highly recommend it to anyone visiting Manhattan.

name: Marjorie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
We had an unforgettable stay in this extraordinary city, guided by the good deals of Milton. The studio is very well located in Harlem, served by 3 different subway lines, and even by express subways that stop well at 125th street.
The neighborhood is endearing with its small shops and supermarkets (don't miss the fish specialties to take away at Lighthouse!). It's perfect for immersing yourself in African American mixed culture, just a stone's throw from the Apollo theater and the gospel churches!
The studio is impeccable in terms of cleanliness, bright, well-equipped especially in terms of cooking. The decoration is very nice, and with views of the gardens and interior courtyards. The bedding is very soft and comfortable.
We'll be back in New York for sure, and we already know we'll be back at Milton's!

review_text:
We came as a couple to discover New York, I mean I’ve selected this airbnb because of the reviews and the pictures, and I was right to follow my instinct.
Milton has been so nice and helpful, he waited for us outside the apartment while we arrived from our late night flight
He made sure we had everything, he bought us some groceries too, how nice
The flat itself is really clean and way enough for two people
The mattress is really comfy, it feels clean too, everything is good !
About the area, we did everything by subway, I’ve read reviews about 10min walk but it is really 5min to the station
The area is safe and interesting, we still booked Lyft or taxi to come back home from Manhattan when it was dark because of laziness and comfort but I’m sure it is fine !
I can only thank again Milton for his welcoming personality, that made our week really special
Also he printed for us our boarding passes for our flight home, which is really nice
I recommend it by 100 !
Merci encore !

As for Milton, we only have words of appreciation. We are waiting until late in the morning on our arrival, he answered at all times with doubts that we were coming up and, in addition, he had the deference of leaving us another room to quietly make a "late check-out".
Definitely a 100% recommended place!
Thank you so much Milton, Milton!

I just wanted to take a moment to thank Iryna for hosting me during my recent stay. While I didn't have the pleasure of meeting her in person, the online communication was good & all of the information for check-in and WiFi was well-documented and easy to follow on the AirBnB webpage.
Although the apartment was quite small, it was cozy and had all the necessary amenities. I really appreciated having a furnace, refrigerator, AC & even a washing machine available during my stay. Climbing up to the bed 2 meters above was a unique experience & made the most of the limited space in the apartment.
The location was great, with easy access to the Madison Square Metro line, which made it easy to get around the city.
But I do have to mention that the apartment staircase and public spaces are not clean, which was a bit of a disappointment. It would be great if the cleaning could be improved to make the overall experience even better.

review_text: The room was clean. The location is very good. Close to supermarket. But there were always insects in the room. Even if I knocked it down, it came out every day, and I couldn't sleep well. We had pesticides, but we sprayed them every day and had to smell them all the time, which was a pain. It's nesting in the back of the kitchen, or it's coming in from somewhere, so I think the host needs to do something about it immediately. Also, the breaker trips easily. The breaker tripped several times during my stay. Also, it may not be the host's fault that the bathroom can't be locked, but there were comments before, but it hasn't been improved, so the management system should be managed somehow. I didn't feel safe taking a bath. The interior of the room is stylish and doesn't feel dirty, so if you can improve the above points, I think it will be a very wonderful room.

My stay was great (even though I had my reservations regarding shared bathrooms)! Iryna is a good host - very responsive and friendly.
Clear instructions allow for easy check-in. Iryna was able to accommodate my early check-in request too. The room was as advertised, high loft bed, microwave, fridge, iron – everything was there. The bed is comfortable (and it was out there, as described), and the AC works well. It is a clean, quiet, and overall homey habitat (I loved the wall art). The shared shower and toilets were capped clean, though the quality of the areas is lacking. Overall, it is a good choice for those on a budget. Furthermore, the prime location makes it a rare find for its value.

review_text: This is a great location for staying in Manhattan, close to subway, and many things to do. Sam was a very responsive host always communicative and helpful. The apartment is vintage, with radiator heating that can make a lot of noise banging at night. The apartment is really small, and this influences the size of the bathroom and kitchen. You cannot simply walk through the bathroom. You have to shuffle sideways its so narrow, and to sit on the toilet request some gymnastics moves. For a larger person it would be a challenge and the shower is also small. The Kitchen as well was very narrow and to move through it you have to shuffle sideways. I think these 100 year old buildings are just like this, so some people might be used to such tight quarters, but not everyone. The bed is a queen mattress on a light metal frame. Its OK for one person.

review_text: This air bnb was very disappointing. Starting with the check in there was some confusion on where the air bnb was even located because the address givin on the app is not the same address the host sends you via text. I believe this is because the real address is not suppose to be used as an airbnb. I found this out because i mentioned the confusion when we met and i said the word “Airbnb” and she rudely told me i could not say that word in her property. Then there was an issue that me and my wife were traveling with our 7 month old baby. She said she does not allow baby’s in her property and when i looked back at the house rules i never saw anything as such. The property overall was ok and the location was great for doing all the tourist stuff for the weekend. Everything in the property is cheap and doesn’t make for a super comfortable stay.Also, the host was not very welcoming and even at check out seemed rude. We were nothing but friendly and kind and didn’t get much of that back.

The check in host was not nice/ provided a mean attitude. Water was accidentally spilled on the bed sheet and then I recieved the nastiest text to my phone number. The place was left just as found.

It also is a 3rd floor walk up with a rather steep staircase. The bathroom overall is fine however the toilet is rather close to the wall so it can be a bit awkward. The one main thing missing was a couch or a comfortable sitting place to relax and watch TV.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Our arrival time was significantly delayed due to airline travel disruptions. Sam was extremely flexible and responsive, even though our anticipated arrival changed several times. The place was small, but that's not surprising, given the Central Manhattan location. (FYI, it's a third floor walk-up, no elevator, also common in that area.) It had lovely touches reminiscent of its original era, early 1900s or earlier - high ceilings, tall windows, crown molding, carved mantle. It had everything we needed and then some, and the location was awesome! Two blocks from the Empire State Building, easy access to many restaurants, the theater district, subway, etc. We come to NYC about once a year and will definitely stay here again!

review_text: Sam’s place was in an extremely good location for central Manhattan tourist exploring. Their communications were good and very friendly in person, we just missed a bit in the sorting out the check in details in messages. We would recommend double checking before your arrival as this is super important for anyone landing after a long trip. Sam help make it right, and they were there if we needed. If you want the heart of manhattan, we definitely suggest their location as a fair priced, central NYC location. Additionally, their apartment has all the essentials, is clean, is private, decent bed, and relatively quiet for being in the heart of the city. We would recommend overall!

I had full use of the kitchen and bathroom, and a charming and super comfortable space, with a bed and a couch, occasional tables, rugs, and terrific, warm lighting too. I brought a bike with me and April had a stand where I could store it safely and comfortably, so that was an added bonus. Her place was central to subways and bikeable streets, and there are lots of restaurants and bodegas nearby too. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

When I arrived she showed me where to shop, find the Subway, gave local advice and was always very kind and helpful throughout my stay. The apartment is spotlessly clean throughout and the bedroom is very comfortable, spacious and quiet and you have use of the kitchen whenever you need.
The subway is a short 5 minute walk from the house and there are supermarkets and shops for you to buy food very nearby. The living room and bedroom have lovely plants and it is a lovely space to come back from the city and relax in. There are bed socks and slippers so your feet are cozy - a lovely thought.
I would gladly recommend April´s home and thank her for making my stay in New York so special.

review_text: April is so kind and it was so comfy here, it felt like staying at a friend’s place. I walked in and was welcomed with a light scent of incense, which I love and made me feel right at home. April supplies a super soft face towel, shower towel, and the coziest house socks. The bedroom I was staying in was clean and spacious and had direct access to the kitchen. The common area is cozy and has a lot of natural lighting. I felt like I had privacy and I felt very safe. Also the temperature was perfect - it’s chilly in November so it was nice coming to a perfectly warm apartment, unlike other air bnb’s in nyc I’ve stayed at where it’s 30 degrees out and there’s no heating, so I’m very thankful for that. The A and C trains are a 5 min walk away. If you have accessibility needs it’s up 2 flights of stairs, this is very common for apartments on the east coast though. I’ll definitely stay here again!

review_text:
Laura is hospitable, friendly and we connected right away. The home is beautifully furnished with antique treasures at every corner - I personally enjoyed myself so much just relishing the beauty in all that she has collected.
The space is comfortable, private and really clean. This is the property of truly home-proud people.
Getting around is amazing located between 2 train/subway stations so accessibility is simple and there are options around. However if you drive, it can be a little bit of a pain getting a roadside parking spot being a residential district, hence be prepared to circle around for a spot or walk a bit.
I had such a great time staying and working out of the room, though if you have a lot of baggage it might be a bit of a challenge moving up and down the steps leading up to the rooms (slightly steep and narrow).
Otherwise, lovely place, even lovelier people who are so filled with love and warmth.

review_text:
It was a great stay at Laura’s place. Thank you Laura for your friendly communication and comfortable accommodation.
• Communicating with Laura was so easy. Definetly I’d be back if I stay in Brooklyn again.
• Cleaning and the bathroom was stunning. Everything was provided. You share the bathroom with the other Airbnb room, not with the host.
• Location is so peacefull, safe. You have to walk 8-10 minutes to subway. Only 2 trains come to that station but they are fast and going to Manhattan. Of course you can stay at Financial District and reach all the subway lines but it is also at x10 price. Brooklyn is a big borough so even Dumbo is like $40-50 with Uber, but the safety is also important for Brooklyn.
• Bed was okay. Could be better? Yes. But it still is comfortable.
• Room is very big. I had 3 luggages and managed to fit in which is a big plus for me.
• The room is on the second floor, carrying luggages can be hard for 10 minutes but price for this wonderful house is great.

It was easy to find, flexible self check-in made it super easy, and it's walkable from a few subway stations - and the trip into Manhattan wasn't too long - the Q or B lines will take you right into midtown, no transfers needed! I only visited Cafe Madeline in the neighbourhood but anything you needed was nearby (groceries, etc). Everything was spotlessly clean, there were clear labels for AirBnB guests, and Laura was a friendly, responsive host. I would definitely stay here again, fabulous place.

Laura's ability to be present and to show that I was heard and not just a transactional host/guest situation made me feel like I lived there! When I would get back from the conference, her dog Ash was great to greet me at the door, and also took part in the conversations as well! I also liked the balance of doing my own thing and Laura being available if needed with any questions.
Laura's clear instructions on navigating the train station stops was super helpful! I loved the plethora of restaurant choices! Purple Yam (Filipino restaurant) is amazing by the way!

Thanks Laura, if we make it to the Big Apple again we know where we will stay!

I booked the accommodation of Laura for 8 days and was not disappointed. Laura is a great, communicative, open-minded , very nice and helpful host.
We were allowed to move freely in the house on the ground floor and the floor where our room was. The information for the check-in was early enough before arrival , so you knew exactly how to find the place and get to your room.
The house is full of art objects of different kinds. So there's something to discover in every corner. Although the majority is for sale, everything is lovingly coordinated. Even the glass jars by the window are lined up in a rainbow color arrangement.
We enjoyed the conversations in the evening with Laura, her daughters or even friends of the family very much .
It was an incredibly great stay and the connection to the subway "Q" is just great. I absolutely recommend this place and hope to be a guest in Laura's house again someday!

Access to the house is simple, the instructions are clear. The metro is 5 minutes by foot (line Q) very accessible and easy to access. The neighborhood is very quiet whether at night or during the day.
I highly recommend this place. It's a peaceful setting if you want to disconnect from the city center.

Laura is a very accommodating and friendly host, the place is as represented in photos. The kitchen is very easy to use, including a guest fridge well labeled for everyone’s belongings. The bathroom is sooo nice, definitely worth soaking in the tub. One thing to note is she runs an antique shop which occupies most of first floor of her house including the living room.
Our one issue is with the subway access, it’s quite spotty. Obviously this isn’t in Laura’s control, and it wont be a forever problem. But there is only one train that stops close to her place and right now it is not running on the weekends and during the week/ evenings the train is not stopping at all stops downtown. Meaning that on weekends you’ll be walking about 22 minutes between the subway to her house and during the week you really should keep your eyes open for notices about the Q train, especially at night.
Still… worth the stay. We’d stay here again :)

name: Tanya
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The interiors are clean and tidy. Equipped with the essentials. Pillows and sheets are all hotel quality.
Getting to the unit, however, is an extreme challenge.
Be forewarned - this place has no elevator, and has steep and narrow stairs. You will have to be physically fit enough to pull your heavy suitcase/luggage up three flights of narrow stairs. The unit is at the 3rd floor.
It is not advisable for senior citizens, people with disabilities, and people with several pieces of luggage in tow.
The description of the place must include a caveat - no elevator - to give potential clients a heads up - especially those who are not familiar with interiors of older buildings in Manhattan. Yes, the listing did not have “Elevator” among its amenities but just like how other listings would typically do, this should have been listed under the “Not Included” section for emphasis.
As to response time, the host did not reply within a reasonable amount of time, at least in my case.

Again, if you or your group don’t have a problem with stairs, consider this place as the best in Manhattan. Loved it.

name: Taif
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
·
January 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
While I truly wanted to give this place 5 stars, one major issue makes it kind of hard to do so.
Before I get into that, let me start with the positives. The place was very clean and had everything you’d need. The location was perfect and close to many things, including restaurants, bars, Times Square, etc.
The host was also great and responsive which made check in easy and smooth.
Now the one (big one) issue. For the two nights I stayed there, the folks in the unit above were so loud that we couldn’t sleep for two nights straight. Usually, noise doesn’t bother me in NYC because it’s expected in such a big city. But this was unbearably loud.
The unit above this one is owned by the same host as this unit and they did try to tell folks to keep it down. But that did nothing.
If it wasn’t for this issue I would def recommend this place to fam and friends in the future.

review_text: We stayed at Menachem’s place for 4 nights and felt right at home from beginning to end! The building was well maintained and the apartment was comfortable & clean. Menachem and his team were very responsive and helpful, even allowing us to leave our bags at the property before and after check out. I would definitely recommend this place to any family or friends visiting New York in the future.
